intro: Hieracium leiopogon, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium leiopogon is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often found in open, sunny environments.
